00063 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00064 class GlvRadiative3
00065 {
00066 private:
00068   //static const long n = numOfRandoms/3;
00069   static const long n = numOfRandoms/2;
00070 
00072   TqperpGenerate qpgen;
00074   TqperpCalculate qpcalc;
00075 
00076   // A large number of specific parameters for the (D)GLV calculation
00077   double _mass2;
00078   double _mg2;
00079   double _en;
00080   double _overEn;
00081   double _length;
00082   double _cr;
00083   double _alphas;
00084   double _gluonlambda;
00085   double _temperature;
00086   double _mu;
00087 
00088   double _dglvBeta;
00089   double _inteferenceFrac;
00090   double _x;
00091   double _overx;
00092   double _k;
00093 
00094   long _switchkmax;
00095   bool _abovekmax;
00096 
00097   bool _diffexclude;
00098 
00104   double GetKmax() const;
00109   double Interference( long m, long zeroes ) const;
00111   double CdotB( long m, long zeroes ) const;
00116   double Summation( long mmin, long zeroes ) const;
00120   double GetdNdxdk() const;
00121 
00122 public:

00151 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00152 void GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::SetParameters( Parameters& inParams )
00153 {
00154   std::vector<double> ReturnedParamsDouble;
00155   std::vector<long> ReturnedParamsLong;
00156   std::list<std::string> ReturnedParamsString;
00157   std::list<std::string>::iterator it;
00158 
00159   // Check that the opacity order in the input file matches
00160   // that of our compiled executable. The opacity is not a runtime choice,
00161   // it's a compile time choice - this just makes sure that it matches, and that
00162   // the opacity is understood by the user
00163   ReturnedParamsLong = inParams.GetParametersLong( "@opacityOrder" );
00164   long opac = ReturnedParamsLong[0];
00165   if ( opac != n )
00166   {
00167     // The opacity doesn't match!!
00168     // Remember that n is defined as a static long above
00169     std::cerr << "Radcalcer, run time opacity doesn't match that set at compile time.\n";
00170     std::cerr << "For possible optimization purposes, opacity is chosen at compile time";
00171     std::cerr << std::endl;
00172     exit(0);
00173   }
00174 
00175   // First, we get the parameters of the medium
00176   // This is: 1st = mu, 2nd = temperature, 3rd = gluon mass, 4th = gluon mean free path
00177   // Here, we only need the gluon mass
00178   // the zDist will need the others
00179   ReturnedParamsDouble = inParams.GetParametersDouble( "@mediumParams" );
00180   _mg2 = ReturnedParamsDouble[2]*ReturnedParamsDouble[2];
00181   _temperature = ReturnedParamsDouble[1];
00182   _gluonlambda = ReturnedParamsDouble[3];
00183   _mu = ReturnedParamsDouble[0];
00184 
00185   // Next, get the jet flavour
00186   ReturnedParamsString = inParams.GetParametersString( "@jetFlavour" );
00187   std::string jetFlavour = ReturnedParamsString.front();
00188   if ( jetFlavour == "Gluon" )
00189   {
00190     _cr = 3.; _mass2 = _mg2;
00191   }
00192   else if ( jetFlavour == "Light" )
00193   {
00194     _cr = 4./3.; _mass2 = _mg2 / 2;
00195   }
00196   else if ( jetFlavour == "Charm" )
00197   {
00198     _cr = 4./3.; _mass2 = 1.2*1.2;
00199   }
00200   else if ( jetFlavour == "Bottom" )
00201   {
00202     _cr = 4./3.; _mass2 = 4.75*4.75;
00203   }
00204   else
00205   {
00206     std::cerr << "@jetFlavour not understood" << std::endl;
00207     exit(0);
00208   }
00209 
00210   // Now, check whether also specifying a jet mass
00211   ReturnedParamsDouble = inParams.GetParametersDouble( "@jetMassDirect" );
00212   if ( ReturnedParamsDouble.size() > 0 )
00213     _mass2 = ReturnedParamsDouble[0]*ReturnedParamsDouble[0];
00214   
00215   // Now, the momentum, to give the jet energy
00216   ReturnedParamsDouble = inParams.GetParametersDouble( "@jetMomentum" );
00217   double jetMomentum = ReturnedParamsDouble[0];
00218   // Now calculate and set energy, and mass
00219   _en = sqrt( _mass2 + jetMomentum*jetMomentum );
00220   _overEn = 1. / _en;
00221 
00222   // The jet path length in the medium
00223   ReturnedParamsDouble = inParams.GetParametersDouble( "@pathLength" );
00224   _length = ReturnedParamsDouble[0];
00225 
00226   // The setting on the k max
00227   ReturnedParamsLong = inParams.GetParametersLong( "@limitSet" );
00228   _switchkmax = ReturnedParamsLong[0];
00229 
00230   // The strong coupling, alpha_s
00231   ReturnedParamsString = inParams.GetParametersString( "@alpha" );
00232   it = ReturnedParamsString.begin();
00233   if ( *it == "fixed" )
00234   {
00235     ++it;
00236     _alphas = boost::lexical_cast<double>( *it );
00237   }
00238   else
00239   {
00240     std::cerr << "Radcalcer, @alpha not understood";
00241     std::cerr << std::endl;
00242     exit(0);
00243   }
00244 
00245   ReturnedParamsString = inParams.GetParametersString( "@incClassicalDiffusion" );
00246   if ( ReturnedParamsString.front() == "yes" )
00247     _diffexclude = false;
00248   else if ( ReturnedParamsString.front() == "no" )
00249     _diffexclude = true;
00250   else
00251   {
00252     std::cerr << "Radcalcer, @incClassicalDiffusion not understood as yes or no";
00253     std::cerr << std::endl;
00254     exit(0);
00255   }
00256 
00257 }

00259 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00260 void GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::SetCoord( long dimension, double value)
00261 {
00262   // Dimension 1 = k
00263   // Dimension 2 = x
00264 
00265   switch (dimension)
00266   {
00267     case 1:
00268       _k = value;
00269       qpcalc.SetK( _k );
00270       break;
00271 
00272     case 2:
00273       _x = value;
00274       _overx = 1. / _x;
00275       _dglvBeta = _mg2*(1.-_x) + _mass2*_x*_x;
00276       _inteferenceFrac = 0.5*_overx*_overEn*overhbarc;
00277       break;
00278 
00279     default:
00280 
00281       break;
00282   }
00283 
00284   ( _k > GetKmax() ) ? _abovekmax = true : _abovekmax = false;
00285 
00286 }
00287 
00288 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00289 void GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::SetRandoms( boost::array<double, numOfRandoms>& randoms )
00290 {
00291   boost::array<double, n> Qs;
00292   boost::array<double, n> Thetas;
00293 
00294   qpgen.SetParameters( _temperature, _en, _mu );
00295   qpgen.GetQsThetas( randoms, Qs, Thetas );
00296   qpcalc.SetQsThetas( Qs, Thetas );
00297 }
00298 
00299 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00300 void GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::GetAnswer( std::vector<double>& answers ) const
00301 {
00302   answers[0] = GetdNdxdk();
00303 }
00304 
00305 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00306 double GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::GetKmax() const
00307 {
00308   double kmax;
00309   switch (_switchkmax)
00310   {
00311     case 1:
00312       // Ivan's first version of k_max
00313       kmax = _x*_en;
00314     break;
00315 
00316     case 2:
00317       // Another version from Ivan's code
00318       _x <= 0.5 ? kmax = _x*_en : kmax = (1.-_x)*_en;
00319     break;
00320 
00321     case 3:
00322       // Magdalena's favourite version of k_max
00323       kmax = 2.*_x*(1.-_x)*_en;
00324     break;
00325 
00326     default:
00327       kmax = -1.;
00328       break;
00329   }
00330   return kmax;
00331 }
00332 
00333 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00334 double GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::Interference( long m, long zeroes ) const
00335 {
00336   const double modLen = _length / static_cast<double>(n+1) *_inteferenceFrac;
00337 
00338   double result1, result2;
00339   double omknLen;
00340   
00341   std::complex<double> den = std::complex<double>(1.,0.);
00342   double qpkk;
00343 
00344   for ( long k=2; k<=m; ++k ) 
00345   {
00346     qpkk = qpcalc.GetSumQskk( k, zeroes );
00347     omknLen = (qpkk+_dglvBeta) * modLen;
00348     den *= std::complex<double>( 1., omknLen );
00349   }
00350   
00351   result1 = den.real() / ( pow(den.real(),2) + pow(den.imag(),2) );
00352   
00353   qpkk = qpcalc.GetSumQskk( 1, zeroes );
00354   omknLen = (qpkk+_dglvBeta)* modLen;
00355   den *= std::complex<double>( 1., omknLen );
00356   
00357   result2 = den.real() / ( pow(den.real(),2) + pow(den.imag(),2) );
00358   
00359   /*
00360   double denreal = 1.; double denimag = 0.;
00361   double qpkk;
00362 
00363   for ( long k=2; k<=m; ++k ) 
00364   {
00365     qpkk = qpcalc.GetSumQskk( k, zeroes );
00366     omknLen = (qpkk+_dglvBeta) * modLen;
00367     denreal -= denimag*omknLen; denimag += denreal*omknLen;
00368   }  
00369   result1 = denreal / ( denreal*denreal + denimag*denimag );
00370   
00371   qpkk = qpcalc.GetSumQskk( 1, zeroes );
00372   omknLen = (qpkk+_dglvBeta)* modLen;
00373   denreal -= denimag*omknLen; denimag += denreal*omknLen;  
00374   result2 = denreal / ( denreal*denreal + denimag*denimag );
00375   */
00376   return ( result1 - result2 );
00377 }
00378 
00379 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00380 double GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::CdotB( long m, long zeroes ) const
00381 {
00382   const double over_qs11 = 1./( _dglvBeta + qpcalc.GetSumQskk( 1, zeroes ) );
00383   const double over_qsmp1mp1 = 1./( _dglvBeta + qpcalc.GetSumQskk( m+1, zeroes ) );
00384   const double over_qsmm = 1./( _dglvBeta + qpcalc.GetSumQskk( m, zeroes ) );
00385 
00386   const double qs1m = qpcalc.GetSumQs1k( m, zeroes );
00387   const double qs1mp1 = qpcalc.GetSumQs1k( m+1, zeroes );
00388 
00389   return ( qs1mp1*over_qsmp1mp1 - qs1m*over_qsmm ) * over_qs11;
00390 }
00391 
00392 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00393 double GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::Summation( long mmin, long zeroes ) const
00394 {
00395   double result = 0.;
00396   for ( long m=mmin; m<=n; ++m )
00397   {
00398     result += Interference( m, zeroes ) * CdotB( m, zeroes );
00399   }
00400   return -2.*result;
00401 }
00402 
00403 template<typename TqperpGenerate, typename TqperpCalculate, std::size_t numOfRandoms>
00404 double GlvRadiative3<TqperpGenerate, TqperpCalculate, numOfRandoms>::GetdNdxdk() const
00405 {
00406   // First, check whether k is over kmax
00407   if ( _abovekmax )
00408   {
00409     return 0.;
00410   }
00411   
00412   double result = 0.;
00413   for ( long i=0; i<TPower<2,n>::value-1; ++i )
00414   {
00415     // If we want to only look at the quantum source term, exclude the classical
00416     // diffusion terms, then we start at n. If we want all of it, then we start at 1.
00417     unsigned long mmin;
00418     _diffexclude ? mmin = n : mmin = 1;
00419     result += Summation( mmin, i ) * qpgen.GetQsEventWeight( i );
00420   }
00421 
00422   result *= _k * _overx * overpi  * _cr *_alphas * 2.;
00423   result *= pow( _length / _gluonlambda, n ) * 1. / SwUtils::_factorial( n );
00424 
00425   return result;
00426 }
